description:
SmartHeritance is a digital legacy planning platform that helps individuals organize and securely pass on everything their loved ones will need - from financial, digital and personal assets to ongoing expenses. 

The reality is, most families face stress, confusion and financial loss when a loved one passes - simply because vital information is scattered, or missing. SmartHeritance solves this by automating the discovery, organization, and secure sharing of key information - ensuring nothing gets lost or unclaimed.

Your legacy is fully preserved and passed on with ease, giving you peace of mind and providing a clear path for your family when it matters most.
problem_statement:
Most families are caught off guard when a loved one passes away. Critical information—like financial accounts, insurance policies, and digital assets—is often scattered or hidden, leaving survivors overwhelmed and unprepared. 

This leads to lost assets, missed benefits, and emotional strain during an already difficult time. SmartHeritance helps individuals organize and securely share key information, so their families aren’t left in the dark when it matters most.

A common pitfall in legacy planning is the lack of ongoing discipline—people may start organizing their affairs but rarely keep things updated. Survivors often don’t know what exists, or who to contact when someone passes away. As a result, assets go unclaimed and critical benefits are missed. SmartHeritance addresses this with automated asset discovery and periodic wellness checks, ensuring that vital information stays current and reaches the right people automatically when it matters most.

market_opportunity.justification:
Target customer: Target customer: 
- Age: 45+ years
- Household income: > $100K
- Net worth: $1M - $20M

Biggest pain point:
	•	Disorganized or incomplete records: Financial accounts, insurance policies, and digital assets are scattered, making it hard to keep track or ensure nothing is missed.
	•	Fear of leaving loved ones unprepared: Customers worry that survivors won’t know what exists, where to find it, or whom to contact after they’re gone.
	•	Lack of time or discipline to maintain a legacy plan: Even with good intentions, most people don’t regularly update their information or revisit plans.
	•	Uncertainty around secure sharing: Customers want to share information—but only with the right people, at the right time, in a secure way.
Market size: TAM: $50B; SAM: $15B (U.S. only)

product_differentiation.justification:
Competitors: 1. Digital Legacy & Organizer Platforms
	•	Everplans – Offers digital vaults to store wills, insurance, and other end-of-life documents.
	•	Trust & Will – Focuses on online estate planning, but includes some legacy tools.
	•	GoodTrust – Helps users manage and share digital assets and social media accounts.
	•	FutureVault – Provides secure digital vaults for organizing personal and financial information.

2. End-of-Life & Death Tech
	•	Empathy – Supports families after a death with tools for managing arrangements, benefits, and grief.
	•	Cake – Helps users with end-of-life planning, including legal, financial, and memorial wishes.

3. Family Wealth Management Tools
	•	Kubera – Tracks net worth and securely stores financial data, with beneficiary access.
	•	Zenplans – A UK-based digital life management platform focused on secure information sharing.

4. Indirect Competitors
	•	Password managers (e.g., 1Password, LastPass) – Often used to store digital information but not optimized for legacy or survivor use.
	•	Traditional estate planners and attorneys – Offer personalized services but lack automation and ongoing updates.

SmartHeritance differentiates itself through automated asset discovery, ongoing wellness checks, and survivor-ready sharing, making it more proactive and continuity-focused than most competitors.
In-market since: Yes. Launched MVP in May '2025.

red_flags:
1.	Behavioral Inertia Around Legacy Planning
Most people understand the importance of organizing their life information but procrastinate due to emotional discomfort or lack of urgency. Overcoming this inertia requires education, trust-building, and seamless onboarding.
	2.	Establishing Trust in a Sensitive Domain
We’re asking users to store sensitive personal and financial data. Building credibility and demonstrating security, privacy, and responsible stewardship is essential for adoption.
	3.	Channel Penetration in a Crowded Benefits Space
The employee benefits ecosystem is crowded, and breaking through to HR leaders and benefits brokers requires strong differentiation and proof of value.

1.	Enterprise Sales Expertise
We need deeper experience and mentorship around navigating complex B2B sales cycles within HR tech and insurance broker channels to accelerate partnership and customer acquisition.
	2.	Strategic Partnerships
While we have initial contacts, we lack broad access to key decision-makers in large benefits platforms and insurance networks critical for scaling distribution.
	3.	Regulatory and Compliance Guidance
Given the sensitive nature of financial and personal data, we seek expert support on evolving data privacy regulations and best practices to ensure full compliance and build user trust.
	4.	Product Scaling & Security
We’re looking for technical advisors to help optimize product architecture for secure data handling at scale and improve automated asset discovery capabilities.

founder_impact_assessment:
Early on, I realized through user interviews that legacy planning is like dental floss—everyone knows they should do it, but almost no one actually does. The barrier wasn’t about importance; it was about discipline, emotional resistance, and the sheer effort involved.

People weren’t just avoiding legal documents—they were overwhelmed by the time it takes to track expenses, organize assets, and keep everything current. Many also pointed out that day-to-day financial details and expenses are a vital part of a family legacy, yet they’re often ignored.

That feedback changed everything. I saw clearly that automation wasn’t a nice-to-have—it was the only way to overcome apathy and make this stick. We pivoted SmartHeritance to focus on a simple, intuitive UI layered with automated asset discovery and wellness checks, turning legacy planning into an easy, ongoing habit. Our goal became clear: reduce the emotional and logistical burden, so families are never left scrambling in the dark.
